subject: Critical Thinking
title: Data Manipulation: How Numbers Lie Honestly
description: A fast breakdown of Data Manipulation: How Numbers Lie Honestly for builders.

hook.text: A graph shows a dramatic spike in crime â€“ until you notice the y-axis starts at 95% instead of 0%.

buildup.text: Data manipulation: presenting real numbers in misleading ways through axis tricks, cherry-picked timeframes, or more.

discovery.text: Darrell Huff's 'How to Lie with Statistics' cataloged tricks still used today: truncated axes, distorted scales.

twist.text: The data is technically correct. The presentation is the lie. This makes it harder to debunk than outright falsehood.

climax.text: Always check: What's the y-axis? What's the timeframe? What's the baseline? What's being compared to what?

punchline.text: Numbers don't lie. But the people presenting them might.

quiz.question: How can a graph be misleading while using accurate data?
options: By truncating axes, cherry-picking timeframes, or omitting context
By using too many data points
